intro: Oenothera hookeri subsp. hewettii, commonly known as Hewett's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, typical of the Onagraceae family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and native plant restoration projects.
